name: Uranium nitricum
Relationship: Compare: SYZYGIUM; PHOS-AC.; LACT-AC.; ARG. NIT.; KALI-BICH.; ARS.; PHLORIDZIN (a glucosidal principle obtained form the bark of the root of the apple and other fruit trees. Produces diabetes and fatty degeneration of the liver; intermittent fever. Daily doses, 15 grains. Phlorizin causes glycosuria. No hyperglycemia results. It compels the secretory epithelium of the kidney to break down serum albumin into sugar. There is no increase in blood sugar.)

Stomach: Ravenous appetite; eating followed by flatulence
Urine: Unable to retain urine without pain
Burning in urethra, with very acid urine
Head: Mental depression
Nostrils sore, with purulent, acrid discharge
Ill-tempered; dull, heavy pain

details: Causes glycosuria and increased urine. Is known to produce nephritis, diabetes, degeneration of the liver, high blood pressure and dropsy. Its therapeutic keynote is GREAT EMACIATION, DEBILITY AND TENDENCY TO ASCITES AND GENERAL DROPSY. Backache and delayed menses. Dry mucous membranes and skin.
